topic.name: World Wars and Interwar Period (1914–1945)
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for World Wars and Interwar Period (1914–1945) in History & Social Studies

objectives.objective_text: Identify soldiers in trenches.
Name the Poppy flower for remembrance.
Identify new weapons (tanks, planes, gas).
Identify that Jewish people were hurt because of who they were.
Name Anne Frank.
Identify the concentration camps.
Identify a scary leader who yells.
Name Hitler and Mussolini.
Identify the Soviet Union and Stalin.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Identify a peace treaty as a promise to stop fighting.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Name the leaders shaking hands.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Identify Woodrow Wilson.
Identify the Allies (Friends) and Axis (Enemies).
Name Churchill and Roosevelt.
Identify Winston Churchill's speeches.
Recall that the whole world started fighting.
Observe that it was called the 'Great War'.
Recall that we must protect people.
Observe the Yellow Star.
Recall that people were poor and hungry (Depression).
Observe flags with swastikas (bad symbols).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Recall that Germany was punished.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Observe a map of new countries in Europe.
Recall that it was a war all over the world.
Observe planes and ships.
Summarize the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand.
Explain M.A.I.N. (Militarism, Alliances, Imperialism, Nationalism).
Explain the stalemate on the Western Front.
Defend the tragedy of the 'Lost Generation'.
Summarize the story of Anne Frank.
Explain what 'Anti-Semitism' is (hating Jews).
Explain the phrase 'Never Again'.
Defend the Imago Dei against dehumanization.
Summarize the Great Depression.
Explain what a Dictator is.
Explain the Spanish Civil War as a dress rehearsal.
Defend the value of freedom of speech in preventing tyranny.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the end of the war (Armistice Day).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Explain why the League of Nations was made (to talk instead of fight).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Explain why the US didn't join the League.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Defend the idealism vs. failure of the League.
Summarize the Blitz (bombing of London).
Explain Pearl Harbor and D-Day.
Explain the role of code-breaking (Enigma).
Defend the concept of the 'Arsenal of Democracy'.
Compare the Triple Entente with the Central Powers.
Analyze the 'Powder Keg' of the Balkans.
Interpret the domino effect of the alliance system.
Connect the industrial arms race to the death toll.
Compare a bully with a rescuer (like Corrie ten Boom).
Analyze the 'Final Solution'.
Interpret the gradual removal of rights (Nuremberg Laws).
Connect the Holocaust to the history of Jewish persecution.
Compare Democracy (voting) with Fascism (obeying).
Analyze the characteristics of Totalitarianism (control of press, police state).
Interpret the rise of Nazism in Germany.
Connect inflation and unemployment to political extremism.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Compare what the winners wanted vs. what the losers got.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the 'War Guilt Clause' and reparations.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the redrawing of the Middle East map (Mandates).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Connect the harsh treaty to the rise of Hitler.
Compare the war in Europe with the war in the Pacific.
Analyze the strategy of Blitzkrieg.
Interpret the turning points (Stalingrad, Midway, El Alamein).
Connect the Atomic Bomb to the end of the war.
Evaluate the question of 'War Guilt' (was it all Germany's fault?).
Evaluate the role of ordinary people ('banality of evil').
Evaluate the policy of Appeasement (Munich Agreement).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the principle of 'Self-Determination' vs. reality.
Evaluate the morality of strategic bombing (Dresden/Hiroshima).
Construct a timeline of the July Crisis.
Synthesize the collapse of the Ottoman, Austro-Hungarian, and Russian empires.
Construct a theology of suffering (Theodicy) post-Holocaust.
Synthesize the impact of the Holocaust on the founding of Israel.
Construct a comparison of Fascism and Communism.
Synthesize the cult of personality in Stalinist Russia and Nazi Germany.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Construct a critique of the Treaty of Versailles.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Treaty of Versailles and League of Nations
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the seeds of WWII sown in 1919.
Construct a strategic overview of the European and Pacific theaters.
Synthesize the geopolitical outcome (US/USSR superpowers).
